oai_dc:dc.dc:title: American Red Cross Canteen
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: unknown
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: American Red Cross Canteen group gathered near railroad tracks [Southern Railway, Knoxville, TN]. On front row, 1st woman from left is Mrs. John Hudson, 3rd from left is Mrs. Horace Van Deventer, 9th from left is Mrs. A.F. Sanford, 10th is Mrs. Henry Kelso, 12th from left is Mrs. J.H. Keeling, and 13th is Mrs. J.H. Stewart. On back row:, 2nd from left is Clyde Gothard, 3rd from left is Mr. A.F. Sanford, 5th is D.C. Campbell, 11th is D.C. (Dave} Chapman, 12th is R.K. Gibson, 13th is Mr. Hugh Gallaher, 15th is Horace Van Deventer. World War I.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Group portraits; Canteens (Wartime, emergency, etc.);
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: To use photographs or to order reproductions, contact DigitalCollections@knoxlib.org or phone 865 215-8808. Please refer to Image Number if available and provide a brief description of the photograph.
